thread.title_full: Gonzalez Leads Flock for Unbeaten Hawks

title: Gonzalez Leads Flock for Unbeaten Hawks
text:
Gonzalez Leads Flock for Unbeaten Hawks 
By Norman Seawright III October 14, 2015 Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 6:40 PM CDT 
Hermantown, MN (NNCNOW.com) -- The 2015 Hermantown High School boys' soccer team is the first in the program's history to record a season with no losses; at front and center of the team—senior captain Siji Gonzalez, who scored twenty goals. 
"As soon as I saw the dedication," he said. "I knew we were going to make it far." 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
The Hawks have 13 seniors—all who were on the 2013 squad that played in the Minnesota State High School League (MSHSL) tournament. Since then, the group's bond has strengthened. 
"These 13 seniors have been part of the same family of brothers all the way through," said head coach Dave Thompson. 
"I think Siji's best ability is his ability to control the ball, and not just shoot it, but settle it and share with his teammates. He's obviously proven to be exceptionally gifted in that way." 
"It's not just us two that carry the team," said senior midfielder Daniel Hedstrom. "We have so many other weapons." 
Hedstrom and Gonzalez often exchange passes on scoring runs, but being able to create offense with other players has helped just as much as the team's ability to relax and enjoy the game. 
"They'll just be fooling around, but once you're on the field," Gonzalez said. "They change." 
Gonzalez has grown from a soft-spoken player to a vocal team leader, never losing his humility. 
"I feel that they trust me so much," he said. "I trust them even more since they're trusting me."
